p: To estimate reactions of the studied species to nitrogen type and dose, final germination percentage (FGP), index of germination velocity (IGV, known as modified Timsonâ€™s index [ 36]) and index of germination synchrony (IGS, known as Z value [ 37]) were calculated. Higher values of FGP (where minimum is 0% and maximum is 100%) indicate greater ability to complete germination. Higher values of IGV (where minimum is 0 and maximum is 100) denote more rapid completion of germination. Higher values of IGS (where minimum is 0 and maximum is 1) indicate greater synchronization of germination. The germination-related parameters were calculated using the germinationmetrics package v. 0.1.3 [ 38] run in R software (v. 3.5.2, 64 bit version [ 39]) with the functions implemented therein.
